title: Mobile Microlearning Expert Course for Designing and Improving Technical College Mathematics Curricula: Computation, Formula, Equation, and Statistics/Probability-Centric Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced mathematical foundations (calculus, probability, statistics), basic understanding of curriculum design, ability to interpret formulas and graphs, fundamental statistical processing skills
context.additional_context: For working professionals: establishing efficient yet limited smartphone-based learning environments. Includes mobile-friendly formula input systems (LaTeX support), graph visualization tools (Desmos), and probability distribution simulators.

learning_goals: Enhancing the ability to design customized mathematics curricula for technical colleges using learning design models and collective meaning-making techniques: strengthening competencies in equation solving, graph interpretation, and proof structure analysis
Acquire the ability to develop 5-step mobile-optimized microlearning modules: implementing computational problem-solving, formula application simulations, and probability distribution visualization
Cultivate the ability to propose flexible curriculum improvement plans through project-based assessment: case studies in statistical analysis, probability modeling, and data interpretation

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
